intro: Leichhardtia, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina, Chile, and Peru. They are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Leichhardtia species often grow in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Their botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact growth habit.
